events.name: eds-masthead-logo-clicked
events.description: fires on click of the home icon

events.name: eds-masthead-brand-clicked
events.description: fires on brand clicked (icon or name)

events.name: eds-masthead-hamburger-icon-clicked
events.description: fires on click of the hamburger icon

events.name: eds-masthead-close-icon-clicked
events.description: fires on click of the close icon

events.name: eds-masthead-responsive-screen-change
events.description:
fires initially and when window is resized, outputs the `screen` type and breakpoint associated with it
We have 3 breakpoints: mobile (0-599px), tablet (600-959px), and desktop (960px and higher)

properties.name: forceShowHamburger
properties.description: boolean to force hamburger on/off in the event `slot=navigation` is not used

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
```
'icon': {
 'loadMethod': ,
 'filename': ,
 'svgString': ,
 'svgStyle': ,
 'baseSvgPath':
}
```
Please refer to `eds-icon` for more information on those properties. By default GE Monogram provided

properties.name: isBrandLink
properties.description: Option to change pointer upon hovering brand name or icon

properties.name: isSidenavCollapsible
properties.description: Option to notify Masthead that current application side navigation is collapsible

properties.name: isToggleIconHamburger
properties.description: Option to force the navigation trigger icon to be either hamburger icon (false) or close icon (true)

properties.name: location
properties.description: The location of the masthead, sidebar or default

properties.name: logo
properties.description: **DEPRECATED** Asset path to the location of the application's logo file

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the application. Best practice is to limit the application name to two lines within maximum width of branding section.

properties.name: status
properties.description: Array of status items to display in the footer

properties.name: topNotificationText
properties.description: to set the top notification text

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of Masthead, valid values are: `default`, `skinny` This is an optional property. By default, masthead will be rendered with type `default`.

EDSMasthead.description: The **masthead** is the top-most element of the application interface and is persistently displayed across all screens of the application user experience. It is where references to the name of the application and brand are most commonly represented. The masthead may also serve as the primary container for key application-wide tools such as navigation, search, notifications, and access to user settings.
EDSMasthead.name: Masthead
EDSMasthead.usage:
The masthead component allows you to specify the header with customer labeling, logo image and any inner content. ```html Any content to render as innerHTML ``` Masthead component has 3 named slots that you can use: navigation, left-content, and utilities. `navigation` slot can be used to integrate the navigation into the masthead `left-content` slot can be used to align content left right after branding area (logo and the title) `utilities` slot can be used to right align content in the masthead, where you might use icons or other components CSS Variable | Description :----------------|:------------- --eds-masthead-text | Text color for masthead --eds-masthead-background | Background color for masthead --eds-masthead-shadow | Color for the dropshadow --eds-masthead-status-text-color | Text color of the status bar --eds-masthead-status-background-color | Background color of the status bar --eds-masthead-icon-color | Icon color --eds-masthead-utility-text | Text color for the utilities slot --eds-masthead-nav-trigger-background-color | Background color of the navigation trigger Here is an example of all 3 slots being used. You can mix and match slots by your design needs: ```html
Left Content Slot
Navigation Slot
Utilities Slot
``` In the demo about all 3 slots are shown regardless of the screen size, but based on the use cases, slot content will be hidden or moved to different location based on screen size. For example, in tablet and mobile screen sizes, navigation slot content will be hidden in the masthead and moves into navigaton component. Moving of the contents in the slots will be done by the application that will be integrating masthead with navigation component. This will shown in detail in the examples section.
